author: UMA GUPTA
title: KPI Green secures 26.6 MW of captive solar projects
contents:
Gujarat-based KPI Green Energy (formerly known as KPI Global Infrastructure) has secured orders to execute captive solar projects aggregating to 23.60 MW (DC) capacity. Out of this, it will execute 23.6 MW for Nouveau Jewellery and 3 MW for Nouveau Diamonds Manufacturing India.
Under the captive power production business segment, KPI develops, transfers, operates, and maintains grid-connected solar power projects for CPP customers. It generates revenue by selling these projects to CPP customers for their captive use requirements.
As of March 31, 2022, KPI commissioned 100+ MW of cumulative solar capacity as an independent power producer (IPP) and 65+ MW as a service provider to captive power producers.
The company aims for a cumulative IPP portfolio of 250 MW by 2025 and a CPP portfolio of 750 MW by 2025.

title: GAIL launches funding scheme for renewable, electric-mobility startups
contents:
GAIL started investing in startups under its Pankh initiative in July 2017. Its upcoming equity investments will be limited to 20% of a startup’s total equity, it said.
It noted that will only consider proposals for funding from entities that are registered as startups by the Indian Department for Promotion of Industrial and Internal Trade (DPIIT). Individuals can also apply, but they must register as companies and secure recognition as “startups” from the DPIIT before submitting their proposals.
The solicitation round will be open until July 31.

author: UMA GUPTA
title: Bihar makes preferential procurement pitch to lithium battery, solar manufacturers
contents:
The Bihar Renewable Energy Development Agency has started accepting expressions of interest from lithium battery and solar module manufacturers to set up factories in Bihar.
All of the bidders who meet the minimum eligibility criteria will be granted provisional empanelment. They will later be eligible to receive preferential procurement incentives.
To be eligible, solar module manufacturers should have at least 25 MW of annual manufacturing capacity. The qualifying capacity for lithium battery manufacturers has been set at a minimum of 50,000 units per year.
Manufacturers must be willing to set up their proposed plants in Bihar within six months. They must agree to set up PV module factories with annual outputs of at least 25 MW, or lithium battery plants with capacities of 50,000 units per year.
